item.title: Find and Replace text in all files that contain it using VIM and grep
item.description: I’m no wizard with VIM or grep, so it helps me to use this post as a cheatsheet. If I need to, for example, rename a method everywhere that it occurs in a project, I use these commands: Recursively list all files in a given directory with matching text, then open them all in vim buffers:1 vim `grep -rwl '/path/to/look/in' -e 'string_to_match'` If you want to avoid binary files, also add the -I option.
